verses.text: \sc Lord\sc*, I cry unto thee: make haste unto me; Give ear unto my voice, when I cry unto thee.
Let my prayer be set forth before thee \add as\add* incense; \add And\add* the lifting up of my hands \add as\add* the evening sacrifice.
Set a watch, O \sc Lord\sc*, before my mouth; Keep the door of my lips.
Incline not my heart to \add any\add* evil thing, To practise wicked works with men that work iniquity: And let me not eat of their dainties.

Let the righteous smite me; \add it shall be\add* a kindness: And let him reprove me; \add it shall be\add* an excellent oil, \add Which\add* shall not break my head: For yet my prayer also \add shall be\add* in their calamities.
When their judges are overthrown in stony places, They shall hear my words; for they are sweet.
Our bones are scattered at the graveâ€™s mouth, As when one cutteth and cleaveth \add wood\add* upon the earth.
But mine eyes \add are\add* unto thee, O \sc God\sc* the Lord: In thee is my trust; leave not my soul destitute.
Keep me from the snare \add which\add* they have laid for me, And the grins of the workers of iniquity.
Let the wicked fall into their own nets, Whilst that I withal escape.
